name.text: 2.7.3.3 Exercise: select the graph associated to each function

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Select the graph associated with each of the following function.

  1. \(f(x)=3|x|\)   [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
  2. \(f(x)=|x+1|\)   [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
  3. \(f(x)=7|x-3|\)   [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text: Sketching the graph of the absolute value of a function is not complicated. In these cases, we have absolute values of lines. It is enough to identify some points and to join them, as we see in the previous exercise. Remember that the absolute value is always positive, so it is in the upper plane.
